description: The <area> and <map> elements define a clickable area on an image.
description_html: The <area> and <map> elements define a clickable area on an image.
name: Image maps

firefox.notes: From Firefox 29 to Firefox 40, the returned value was incorrectly percent-decoded.

firefox_android.notes: From Firefox for Android 29 to Firefox for Android 40, the returned value was incorrectly percent-decoded.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 9, the host of an <a> always include the port (e.g. developer.mozilla.org:443), even if there is no explicit port in the href attribute value.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 49, results for URL using the blob scheme incorrectly returned null.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 49, results for URL using the blob scheme incorrectly returned null.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 53, the pathname and search HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils properties returned the wrong parts of the URL. For example, for a URL of https://z.com/x?a=true&b=false, pathname would return '/x?a=true&b=false' and search would return '', rather than '/x' and '?a=true&b=false' respectively. This has now been fixed.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 53, the pathname and search HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils properties returned the wrong parts of the URL. For example, for a URL of https://z.com/x?a=true&b=false, pathname would return '/x?a=true&b=false' and search would return '', rather than '/x' and '?a=true&b=false' respectively. This has now been fixed.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 53, the pathname and search HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils properties returned the wrong parts of the URL. For example, for a URL of https://z.com/x?a=true&b=false, pathname would return '/x?a=true&b=false' and search would return '', rather than '/x' and '?a=true&b=false' respectively. This has now been fixed.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 53, the pathname and search HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils properties returned the wrong parts of the URL. For example, for a URL of https://z.com/x?a=true&b=false, pathname would return '/x?a=true&b=false' and search would return '', rather than '/x' and '?a=true&b=false' respectively. This has now been fixed.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 63, rel="noopener" created windows with all features disabled by default. Starting with Firefox 63, these windows have the same features enabled by default as any other window.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 63, rel="noopener" created windows with all features disabled by default. Starting with Firefox for Android 63, these windows have the same features enabled by default as any other window.

ie.notes: Only supported in IE11 in later versions of Windows 10 (creators update). (Per caniuse.com.)

notes: Before Firefox 5, in Quirks Mode, empty maps were no longer skipped over in favor of non-empty ones when matching.

Before Firefox 17, the default styling of the <map> HTML element was display: block;. This is now display: inline; and matches the behavior of the other browsers. It was already the case in Quirks Mode.
